basics.name: Thinh Lam
basics.label: Student
basics.summary: I am studying for a B.S. in Computer Engineering in the College of Engineering at the University of Hawaii. I expect to graduate in Spring, 2018.

work.summary: Intern in the Computer Hardware Infrastructure Division
highlights: Delivered on-site technical support that included installation, maintenance, and repairs of desktops, printers, scanners in Straub Medical Center.
Assisted in researching and implementing the new EPIC software upgrade for the entire HPH computer systems.
Mapped and Troubleshot out-of-date, problematic computers in Straub Medical Center.

work.summary: Assist Servpac Engineers in installing, maintaining, and repair target Network Infrastructure
highlights: Programmed and installed telecommunications equipment including switches, system routers, VoIP phones, NTU.
Assisted System Engineers in installing wireless satellites in multiple commercial buildings to provide high bandwidth internet.
Maintained a computerized record of incoming supplies/equipment for easy access and installations.
Assisted the Recreational Therapists in organizing entertaining events for patients / non-patients
Planned lessons and taught pre-teens children.
Organized fun events to increase sociability and memories among the children in the church.

awards.title: Everett E. Black Scholarship
awards.awarder: College of Engineering at UH Manoa
awards.summary: Everett E. Black Scholarship is dedicated for students who has strong commitment in serving the communities in Hawai'i in the area of engineering.

awards.title: Dean's List
